La Nyalla Sebut DPD RI Butuh Kantor di Tiap Provinsi
03 Nov 2019, 13:47 by Muhammad Irfan
JAKARTA, (PR).- Ketua Dewan Perwakilan Daerah Republik Indonesia, La Nyalla Mahmud Mattalitti menilai perlunya pembangunan kantor DPD di semua provinsi di Indonesia. Hal ini mengingat fungsi senator sebagai perwakilan dan penyampai isu-isu daerah ke tingkat nasional. Menurut dia, dengan adanya kantor daerah, maka konektivitas antara pusat dan daerah akan lebih baik.
Dalam temu media yang digelar di Surabaya, Sabtu 2 November 2019, La Nyalla menuturkan kantor daerah juga bisa mewujdukan komitmen DPD RI untuk lebih dekat dan hadir di tengah masyarakat dalam memperjuangkan kepentingan serta aspirasi daerah. Ini mengacu pada UU MD3 juga yang menugaskan senator memudahkan aspirasi daerah.
"DPD RI mengembangkan artikulasi politik daerah bekerja bersama-sama dengan pemerintah daerah untuk membangun daerah," kata La Nyalla.
Saat ini, DPD baru memiliki tiga kantor DPD yang representatif di tiga provinsi yaitu Sumatera Selatan, Yogyakarta, dan Nusa Tenggara Timur. Sisanya di 11 provinsi sudah meneriba hibah dan telah melakukan balik nama atas nama DPD, akan tetapi belum bisa dibangun karena masih terkena moratorium.
"Akan tetapi ini akan menjadi prioritas di kepemimpinan saya untuk dapat membangun kantor daerah tersebut," ucap dia.
Sementara itu, Wakil Ketua DPD Nono Sampono menilai peluang untuk memperkuat kewenangan dan peran DPD terbuka karena akan ada amandemen UUD 1945. Menurut dia, DPD dan DPR memang setara dalam kedudukan, tetapi tugas, kewenangan, dan fungsi di antara keduanya masih jauh.
"Indonesia memang tidak menganut murni bikameral seperti negara federal, tapi DPD dan DPR sebagai mitra bertujuan melakukan check and balance. Hanya saja dengan tidak sepadannya tugas antara DPR dan DPD maka tidak mungkin itu bisa dilakukan," ucap dia.***

La Nyalla Mention DPD RI Needs Offices in Each Province
03 Nov 2019, 13:47 by Muhammad Irfan
JAKARTA, (PR) .- Chairman of the Regional Representative Council of the Republic of Indonesia, La Nyalla Mahmud Mattalitti assesses the need for the construction of DPD offices in all provinces in Indonesia. This is considering the function of the senator as a representative and conveyor of regional issues to the national level. According to him, with the presence of a regional office, connectivity between the center and the regions will be better.
In a media meeting held in Surabaya, Saturday, November 2, 2019, La Nyalla said that the regional office could also show the commitment of the DPD RI to be closer and present in the community in fighting for regional interests and aspirations. This refers to the MD3 Law which also assigns senators to facilitate regional aspirations.
"The DPD RI is developing regional political articulation working together with the regional government to develop the region," La Nyalla said.
At present, the DPD only has three representative DPD offices in three provinces namely South Sumatra, Yogyakarta and East Nusa Tenggara. The rest in 11 provinces have received grants and have carried out names on behalf of the DPD, but have not been able to build them because they are still affected by the moratorium.
"But this will be a priority in my leadership to be able to build the regional office," he said.
Meanwhile, Deputy Chairperson of the DPD Nono Sampono assessed that the opportunity to strengthen the authority and role of the DPD is open because there will be an amendment to the 1945 Constitution.
"Indonesia is indeed not purely bicameral as a federal state, but the DPD and the DPR as partners aim to carry out checks and balances. It's just that with the inadequate tasks between the DPR and the DPD it is not possible that it can be done," he said. ***
